snippet.title: Weightlifter's Nunawading unit raises the bar at auction - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:

A FORMER Olympic weightlifter has picked up a hefty sum for his modest Nunawading home. Sam Coffa's three-bedroom unit at , surged $70,000 beyond reserve, selling for $813,400, at its July 29 auction. Coffa, the deputy chairman of the Gold Coast 2018 Commonwealth Games Corporation, competed as a weightlifter at the 1962 Commonwealth Games, the 1964 World Championships and the 1964 Tokyo Olympic Games.
Former Olympic weightlifter Sam Coffa is now Gold Coast 2018 Commonwealth Games Corporation deputy chairman. Picture: Stuart McEvoy
Ray White Blackburn senior sales executive Helen Gikas said the home attracted a mix of buyers. "We had first-home buyers, investors, and second-home buyers," Ms Gikas said. "It was a long auction that went right down to $100 increments; we recorded around 82 bids in total. SUBURB PROFILE:
Coffa's unit attracted about 82 bids at auction.
She said the auction lasted 30 minutes before the keys were won by a couple. "We had some very disappointed first-home buyers who missed out," she said. "They thought the property might sell in the range where they'd receive the stamp duty discount." CoreLogic recorded a 13 per cent rise in Nunawading's median unit price across the 12 months to April. It is now at a new high of $666,385.
